resources.string: Which of the statements below best completes this statement?\n AI refers to computer systems that:
A. Can mimic human beings in perception and rationality with high accuracy
B. Can perform complex tasks with higher efficiency than human competitors
C. Can learn as humans do and demonstrate improvement if set to execute the same or similar tasks repeatedly
In the wake of early advances in AI in the 1950s, Allan Turing developed a test to tell \'intelligent\' computer systems and human beings apart. What was the name of the test?
A computer was considered to have passed the above test if:
A. A judge was convinced the computer imitated the human being with an accuracy of at least 65%
B. The computer performed equally as well as or better than the average human player in the traditional Chinese game of Go
C. A person receiving information from both the computer and a human being was unable to differentiate between the two sources on that basis of the information alone
D. A human being determined that the computer system was self-aware
Which of the following terms is not associated with Artificial Intelligence
